newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toyama Chem to step up UK test of Alzheimer's drug.
newsitem.headline: Toyama Chem to step up UK test of Alzheimer's drug.

text.p: Toyama Chemical Co Ltd said on Tuesday it would start phase 2 of three-stage clinical trials for a drug used to treat Alzheimer's-type dementia next month in Britain.
The company said a phase 1 study of the drug, T-588, in Britain was completed as scheduled in June.
The drug is currently being tested in a phase 2 clinical test in Japan, it said in a statement.

"We want to secure recognition of its safety and efficacy in overseas countries and to accelerate collaboration with overseas companies for the development of T-588 as an international product," the statement said.
At present, Tacrine, a drug produced by U.S. firm Warner-Lambert Co is the only drug approved as an anti-dementia agent in the United States, the statement said.
